required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Examine the Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of AMG 623 in Subjects With Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of AMG 623 Following Multi-dose Administration in Subjects With Systemic Lupus Erythematosus

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to evaluate the safety of AMG 623 in subjects with systemic lupus erythematosus. All subjects will receive 4 weekly doses of study drug over a 3 week period, and then will be followed for an additional 28 weeks, for total study duration of 31 weeks.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of treatment emergent adverse events
Incidence of abnormal clinically significant vital signs
Incidence of abnormal clinically significant chemistry, hematology and urinalysis test results
Incidence of abnormal clinically significant ECG results

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics profile of AMG 623 including Tmax, AUClast and Cmax

arm_group.description: Multiple doses of AMG 623 administered as subcutaneous and intravenous doses
Multiple doses of AMG 623 administered as subcutaneous and intravenous doses

intervention.description: Multiple doses of AMG 623 administered as subcutaneous and intravenous doses
Multiple doses of AMG 623 administered as subcutaneous and intravenous doses

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women between the ages of 18 and 65 years old
- Diagnosis of SLE
- Stable disease; defined as no change in SLE therapy within the previous 30 days. Up to 5 mg/day incremental changes of prednisone therapy is allowed during the 30 days prior to randomization
- SLE disease duration of at least 1 year, as diagnosed by a physician
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current renal disease
- Signs or symptoms of viral or bacterial infection within 30 days of enrollment
- Any disorder (including psychiatric), condition or clinically significant disease (other than a diagnosis of SLE) that would interfere the study evaluation, completion and/or procedures per the investigator's discretion
- Administration of more than 10 mg/day prednison (or equivalent) in the 30 days prior to randomization
